title: NBJX64-B1.iso
description:
This is a 64bit, Mepis Linux based, Fluxbox only live CD remaster.
Tweaked by http://mepislovers.org forum member, NoobJason. 
I&#039;m just doing this for a fun project but I decided to share. All feedback/bug reports/suggestions welcome. I&#039;m here to learn.

It&#039;s my first working remaster so this should be !!USED FOR TESTING/EXPERIMENTAL USE ONLY!!

Login as &#039;demo&#039;
Password &#039;demo&#039;
Root password &#039;root&#039; --for SHUTDOWN/REBOOT, installation and admin tools


Programs installed
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Fluxbox-windows manager
SLiM-Login Manager 
Catfish-file search utility
Rox Filer-light weight file browser
Nautilus-heavy weight file browser, great for auto mounting
Kpackage-package manager, great for installing .deb packages downloaded from net
Synaptic-package manager, general purpose with stock Mepis repos activated. Others listed.
Azureus-Sweet bittorrent program
Ark-file compression utitlity, like for zip files
Amarok-heavy weight audio media thingy, internet radio, library, CD&#039;s, whatever...like iTunes for Linux
XMMS-super sweet, lightweight, attractive audio player
VLC-media player, great for video files of all types
Brasero-disc burning utility
Kmix-sound mixer, docks to taskbar on startup
Alsa tools/mixer- sound mixer/configurtion tool
Gimp-full featured image editor
Abiword-middle weight (?), word processer
Geany-text editor, aimed at programmers and maybe web page builders
Leafpad-light weight, simple, text editor
Kcalc-sweet little calculator
HPlip-printer setup tools/printer utilities for HP printers.
Konsole-full featured terminal-I like it for it&#039;s easy to configure infinite history and copy/paste abilities
Wterm-light weight terminal-I like cus&#039; it look great and it&#039;s good enough for day to day
Conky-hightly configurable, light weight performance monitor (left hand corner, C1=core one, C2=core two, RM=ram, SP=swap, RT=root space aka space left on installed partition)
Xkill-once engaged, the mouse cursor changes into an assassin...the next window you click it dead! Great for stopping run away programs.
Keep-back-up/restore utility (have not tested yet)
Gparted-patitioning tool
Mepis assistants-Warrens tools for configuring Mepis (Network, System, User and Xconfig)

libdvdcss2 files-installed so you can play DVD&#039;s, right out of the box. May be illegal in your country!!
Xorg files-Updated with the Lenny repo. This will allow you to boot on more machines than the current release of Mepis. AntiX also has this feature. Go Antix!

*Only &#039;slim&#039;, &#039;catfish&#039; and &#039;xorg&#039; files are from Lenny. Everything else is from the regular Mepis repos.

Known issues
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Using the "Restart" Fluxbox button in the menu seems to cause excessive CPU usage. I have not found the cause yet.

-Even after many attempts at editing the sudoers file (with the &#039;visudo&#039; command), I was unable to put a "Shutdown" & "Reboot" in the menu without giving a password. Sorry for the inconvienience. If you can fix it, let me know how you did it!!

-I recommend a &#039;update all&#039; with Synaptic upon installation. Seems to make flash work.

Enjoy!

P.S. Thanks Anticapitalista!
